CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 2, 1957, pg. A8, reads: "Scouts Receive Awards - At the Court of Honor services for Boy Scout Troop 93, at Grace Memorial Presbyterian Church, the following awards were made: 'God and Country,' Butler, Ables, Hardaway and J. Miller; elevated to Life Scouts, Nelson and Harris; elevated to Star Scouts, R. Page and R. Lavellet [Lavelle]. Benjamin and Kirvin were elevated to Scouts Second Class.  Front row, left to right: Oscar Harris, Charles Benjamin, Robert Lavelle, Raymond Page, Anthony Kirvin, Robert Nelson.  Back row: Edward Platek, Scoutmaster of Troop 70; James Miller, Jerry Ables, Herbert Hardaway and Ray Sarnewski, Scoutmaster of Troop 70, also.  L. V. Hooe is Scoutmaster of Troop 93. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Boy Scouts from troop 93, front row from left: Oscar Harris, Charles Benjamin, Robert Lavelle, Raymond Page, Anthony Kirvin, Robert Nelson; back row: Scoutmaster of troop 70 Edward Platek, James Miller, Jerry Ables, Herbert Hardaway, and Scoutmaster of Troop 70 Ray Sarnewski, posed in Grace Memorial Presbyterian Church
